title: Crispy Chickpea Flour Fish With Fresh Fruit Salsa
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Crispy Chickpea Flour Fish With Fresh Fruit Salsan a try. This gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe serves 3 and costs $2.19 per serving. One serving contains 325 calories, 16g of protein, and 21g of fat. This recipe is typical of Mexican cuisine. 1 person found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. A mixture of pepper, kiwi, salt, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the pepper you could follow this main course with the Easy Peppermint Dessert as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 4 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 80%, this dish is super. Try Crispy Broccoli Rabe, Chickpea, And Fresh Ricotta Salad, Crispy Baked Fish with Tropical Salsa, and Crispy Fish with Charred Corn and Sun Gold Salsa for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve
productMatches.description: An intense golden color with hints of ocher, the wine has a nose of ripe fruit, quince. In the mouth the attack is both supple and full, with notes of honey and spices. The final perfectly balances sugar and acidity.Pair this wine alongside pan-fried foie gras, grilled or roasted white meats (pork, veal), rabbit, poultry in cream sauce, smoked fish, mushroom dishes such as risotto.

instructions: In a medium bowl, combine ingredients 9-14 and put into refrigerator to chill.In a shallow dish, combine chickpea flour, salt, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and pepper. Lightly dredge the fillets in the chickpea flour pressing lightly to make the chickpea flour stick to both sides of the fish. Place a saute pan, with olive oil, over medium high heat until oil shimmers. Place the fillets in the hot oil and saute for 3-4 minutes per side (until chickpea flour is crispy and golden brown).Serve the crusted fillets with fruit salsa either spooned over the top or on the side.Welcome to My Man's Belly! Leave me a comment and let me know what you think about the site or if there's a recipe you'd like to see here. Have a great day.Like this? You'll love these:Dont be Intimidated  Sole MeunireRich and Delicious Gluten Free Chocolate CakeFlavored Homemade Flour TortillasGrilled Whole Red Snapper RecipePersian Fried ChickenGinger Miso Salmon

steps.step: In a medium bowl, combine ingredients 9-14 and put into refrigerator to chill.In a shallow dish, combine chickpea flour, salt, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and pepper. Lightly dredge the fillets in the chickpea flour pressing lightly to make the chickpea flour stick to both sides of the fish.
Place a saute pan, with olive oil, over medium high heat until oil shimmers.
Place the fillets in the hot oil and saute for 3-4 minutes per side (until chickpea flour is crispy and golden brown).

Serve the crusted fillets with fruit salsa either spooned over the top or on the side.Welcome to My Man's Belly!
